meanings.sent1: The flag had a tierced design with three equal sections.
meanings.sent2: The cake was tierced into three parts for sharing.
meanings.sent3: The tierced pizza slices made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her tierced hair color was as unique as a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The tierced pattern on the wall was mesmerizing to look at.

meanings.definition: To divide into three equal parts.
meanings.sent1: She tierced the paper into three sections for the project.
meanings.sent2: They tierced the land equally among the siblings.
meanings.sent3: He tierced the sandwich for a fun twist on lunch.
meanings.sent4: The artist tierced the canvas with bold strokes of color.
meanings.sent5: Tiercing the ingredients evenly is crucial for the recipe to turn out right.
